snippet: The ceremony at the borough’s zoo was a calmer affair than those of recent years, with no bites or falls (and no Mayor Bill de Blasio).
abstract: New York State Lieutenant Gov Kathy Hochul presides over Staten Island's annual Groundhog Day celebration, at which it is declared that spring will come early in 2016; celebration has been perilous for New York City mayors in recent years, and some speculate Mayor Bill de Blasio's absence is due to death of groundhog involved in 2014 ceremony.
lead_paragraph: The ceremony at the borough’s zoo was a calmer affair than those of recent years, with no bites or falls (and no Mayor Bill de Blasio).

headline.main: Staten Island Groundhog Makes Star Turn, This Year Without de Blasio
headline.print_headline: Groundhog in Star Turn. No Mayor? No Problem.
